title.narrative: Improved audit quality and timeliness at AGD

comment.narrative: AGD has achieved 100% of audits within annual plan

title.narrative: Increase in the percentage of designated technical staff trained on relevant statistical training, as planned

Evidence that improved public audit functions by AGD have increased accountability and transparency in the use of public funds, as reflected in the annual public audit cycle submissions by AGD to Parl

baseline.value: AGD submissions to Parliament indicate that audits are 2-4 years late and 50% of SOEs covered by audit

target.value: Audit delay reduced to max 1 yr and 100% of SOEs covered by audit

actual.value: Maximum audit delay is less than 1 year and 100% SOEs covered by audit

title.narrative: DCS is the main source of national statistical data for the country, as reflected in the National Data Committee reports.

baseline.value: National Accounts data not harmonized within the statistical system

actual.value: Regular meetings of NDC held. 6 or more meetings held till close of project

title.narrative: Increasing percentage of investigative and performance audits conducted over total audits by AGD

comment.narrative: 10 performance audits done + 8 in progress; 10 investigative audits done + 9 in progress

title.narrative: Percent of technical staff trained and using recommended practices (including IT-based audits)

comment.narrative: Number and % of technical staff trained :English 544 = 54%Computer 419 = 42%Post Graduate 72 = 7%Financial Audit 398 =39%Investigative Audit 83 = 8%Performance Audit 89= 9%IFRS 300 = 30%

title.narrative: Decreased processing times and increased quality for key national economic and social surveys produced by DCS

baseline.value: 48 month processing time (National Census) and 18 months for household surveys

actual.value: The current census is based on scanning technology replacing manual data entry. Time is drastically reduced.

comment.narrative: Data on precessing time of Census will be available after Census completion (December 2011).

title.narrative: Improved access to data and dissemination of data outputs; facilitating user-education through workshops and website

baseline.value: A data sharing policy has been articulated; Inadequate user education

target.value: Review of new data sharing policy based on feedback from users; regular user eduaction.

actual.value: Third seminar on user education was conducted in Oct. 2011 successfully.

title.narrative: Data processing of next HIES survey incorporates to a reasonable extent the data entry methodology as tested by the HIES pilot

target.value: HIES surevey completed according to a new data collection scheme.

actual.value: HIES surevey completed according to a new data. As a result data processing time has been reduced from 1 yr to 5 months.

comment.narrative: This is a survey done in every 4 years. In the previous survey, 2006/07 only 6 districts were decentralized. In the recent survey,a total of 14 districts out of 24 have been decentralized (incl. some districts in the North and the East)

title.narrative: Evidence of the improved effectiveness, efficiency, and productivity for two key public sector agencies (DCS and AGD)

baseline.value: No evidence of effectiveness and productivity

target.value: Strong evidence of effectiveness and productivity (as measured by surveys at MTR and ICR)

actual.value: DCS component PDOs not achieved and the component was cancelled. AGD was able to demonstrate improved efficiency, effectveness andproductivity in work and capacity of staff

comment.narrative: Office building of DCS was substantially delayed and was not completed by project closing date. GoSL decided to complete thebuilding with its own resources. Some of the consultancies were also not completed by project closing date by DCS. The trainingplan 2011 for DCS could not be completed because of the census.
